channel.title: Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: Appendix to Lecture Notes 10
item.description: Lecture notes on an example of transformation formula of integration limits.

item.title: Lecture Notes
item.description: SES # TOPICS Probability distributions and random variables I. Probability 1 Sets and events (PDF) 2 Probabilities and counting rules (PDF) 3 Conditional probability and independence (PDF) II. Random variables and distribution functions 4 Bayes theorem and random variables (PDF) 5 Discrete and continuous random variables (PDF) 6 Probability distribution functions (PDFs), cumulative distribution functions (CDFs), joint distribution of 2 or more random variables (PDF) 7 Joint and marginal distributions (PDF) 8 Review (PDF) Expectations and transformations of random variables

item.title: Lecture Notes 1
item.description: Lecture notes with an overview of the course and an introduction to set theory and events.

item.title: Lecture Notes 10
item.description: Lecture notes on functions of two or more random variables, and a change of variables formula for one-to-one transformations,

item.title: Lecture Notes 11
item.description: Lecture notes on order statistics and the distribution of the “first digit of anything.”

item.title: Lecture Notes 12
item.description: Lecture notes on properties of medians and percentiles, variance, and high-order moments.

item.title: Lecture Notes 13
item.description: Lecture notes on covariance, regression, and conditional expectations.

item.title: Lecture Notes 14
item.description: Lecture notes on conditional expectations, special distributions, the normal distribution, the DeMoivre-Laplace theorem, drawing standard normal random variables, functions of standard normals, chi-squared, t-, and F-distribution, and cumulative areas under the standard normal distribution.

item.title: Lecture Notes 15
item.description: Lecture notes on special distributions, the Poisson distribution, asymptotic theory, the law of large numbers, and the wisdom of crowds.

item.title: Lecture Notes 16
item.description: Lecture notes with information on general exam policies, a review of functions of random variables, expectations, special distributions, asymptotic theory, and sample problems.

item.title: Lecture Notes 17
item.description: Lecture notes on the central limit theory, estimation, and general properties of estimators.

item.title: Lecture Notes 18
item.description: Lecture notes on properties of estimators, standard error, methods for constructing estimators, the method of moments, and maximum likelihood estimation (MLE).

item.title: Lecture Notes 19
item.description: Lecture notes on maximum likelihood estimation (MLE), conﬁdence intervals, and important cases.

item.title: Lecture Notes 2
item.description: Lecture notes on probability of events, properties of probabilities, simple probabilities, counting rules, and the presidential death date paradox.

item.title: Lecture Notes 20
item.description: Lecture notes on confidence intervals and hypothesis testing.

item.title: Lecture Notes 21
item.description: Lecture notes on evaluating and constructing hypothesis tests.

item.title: Lecture Notes 22
item.description: Lecture notes on the Neyman-Pearson lemma and construction of tests.

item.title: Lecture Notes 23
item.description: Lecture notes on hypothesis testing.

item.title: Lecture Notes 24
item.description: Lecture notes on point estimation, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, two-sample tests, and the method of moments.

item.title: Lecture Notes 3
item.description: Lecture notes on counting rules and probabilities, independent events, conditional probability, and conditional independence.

item.title: Lecture Notes 4
item.description: Lecture notes on Bayes theorem, probability, and random variables.

item.title: Lecture Notes 5
item.description: Lecture notes on discrete random variables, the binomial distribution, and continuous random variables.

item.title: Lecture Notes 6
item.description: Lecture notes on mixed random variables, distributions, cumulative distribution functions, and joint distributions of two tandom variables.

item.title: Lecture Notes 7
item.description: Lecture notes on joint distributions of two random variables, conditional probability distributions, marginal probability density functions, and independence.

item.title: Lecture Notes 8
item.description: Lecture notes on conditional probability distributions, probability, random variables and distribution functions, and random problems.

item.title: Lecture Notes 9
item.description: Lecture notes on functions of random variables, the discreet case, the continuous case, the change of variables formula for one-to-one transformations, the probability integral, and quantile transformation.
